result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamaray Desean Chase was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision in 15CF3992, and in count two of this case to be paid during Extended Supervision.

**01-10-17 Court ordered defendant not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim.
Court will allow third  party contact for purpose of visitation with child(ren).
No firearms.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with 15CF3992.  *5/6/2016 Honorable Michelle Havas-Order signed.  Credit amended to 154 days, count two only.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered pleas on 11-6-2015 with the REPEATER enhancer as to each count.  Court makes a finding of habituality.  Defendant is currently serving a revocation sentence in 09CF335.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by all parties; additional statement by Parish S.
AS to count 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 6 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.  Court orders the payment of all ordered financial obligations in 15CF3992 and in count 2 of this case to be paid during extended supervision.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Court will allow for third party contact for purposes of visitation with child(ren)
-No contact with victim.
-Possess no firearms.
AS to count 2:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent with 15CF3992.  The court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, assessments and surcharges  as a condition of Extended Supervision as imposed in count 1 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
Defendant remanded.
CR-233 filed.

Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 amended to BATTERY, Repeater with Domestic Abuse assessments, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1) 939.62(1)(b) and 973.055(1), a Class A misdemeanor.
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty.   Court made a finding of habituality.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant remanded pending sentencing on 11-10-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lamaray Desean Chase not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has new charges pending and will be going through INTAKE court today.  Case is adjourned to 11-6-2015 at 8:15 for further proceedings.  Defendant to be produced from MSDF.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lamaray Desean Chase not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is currently in custody at MSDF and was not produced.  Court heard and granted the motion of the State to Adjourn Jury Trial, due to the unavailability of the officer witness.  Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned to Branch 38 on 11-2-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
to Adjourn from the State, received and filed.   mld

Court held a conference with counsel in chambers.  The original pretrial offer was conveyed to defendant, who refused the offer.  Court vacates the Speedy Trial entered on 4-9-2015, and ordered that the cash bond in the amount of $2,000.00 is now converted to a signature bond in the amount of $2,000.00.  Court ordered case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Jury panel in court.  Court struck jury panel based on the lack of diversity.   mld

Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Lamaray Desean Chase not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Further Final Pretrial Conference requested by parties, based on the additional discovery received today's date.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-11-2015 at 1:30 am.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 5-11-2015 at 1:30 pm.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Drug testing, breathalyzer tests and absolute sobriety.  Release for (verified) employment and medical / dental appointments.   mld
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and denied by the Court.  The Court ordered gps supervision as a condition of bail.   mld

Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jonathan Mejias-Rivera.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Available discovery turned over to defense counsel from the State.  There are medical records that are still outstanding, per the State.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-6-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 5-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Parish S

Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Lamaray Desean Chase in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
